Rost6v saw the Cossacks and then the first and second squadrons of hussars and infantry battalions and artillery pass by and go forward and then Generals Bagrati6n and Dolgorukov ride past with their adjutants. All the fear before action which he had experi- enced as previously, all the inner struggle to conquer that fear, all his dreams of distin- guishing himself as a true hussar in this battle, had been wasted.
